page.title: 13TRANSPORT 2
page.content: such as Pleasington, Blackburn, Church,Accrington, Burnley and Nelson. The railway was never extended to Oswaldtwistle and residents here have to go to Church (about l to 2 miles) to get a train. It is a multiple track system and is on an embankment for most of the way. There are two main peak times, 6 a.m. to 9 a.m. and 4 p.m. to 5 p.m. It is a slow train and a conductor comes around for your fare rather like on a bus. One part of the railway lines has an interesting name. Where the railway bridge crosses Blackburn Road the surrounding area is known as "2O steps". This is because at one time it was possible to go up onto the bridge and down again (26 steps up and 2O down the other side).
